widgets.onCreate:
set(getProp("parent", "variables").parent + "_" + getProp("parent", "variables").n + "_r", 255)
set(getProp("parent", "variables").parent + "_" + getProp("parent", "variables").n + "_g", 100)
set(getProp("parent", "variables").parent + "_" + getProp("parent", "variables").n + "_b", 0)
widgets.onValue:
set(getProp("parent", "variables").parent + "_" + getProp("parent", "variables").n + "_r", value[0])
set(getProp("parent", "variables").parent + "_" + getProp("parent", "variables").n + "_g", value[1])
set(getProp("parent", "variables").parent + "_" + getProp("parent", "variables").n + "_b", value[2])

widgets.label: auto

widgets.onValue: console.log("color: " + value)

widgets.label: G

widgets.onValue: set(getProp("parent", "variables").name + "_dim_value", value * 100)
set(getProp("parent", "variables").parent + "_" + getProp("parent", "variables").name + "_value", value)

widgets.value:
With these settings, you can adjust the level of the sound input.

In the background, the sound is analyzed using the RMS algorithm. You can use the parameters to determine how the value is used for the speed of the visuals and moving head movements.

Pre-Add: Value that is added before the gain.
Gain: The level is multiplied by this value. If the value is 0, there is no longer any sound reactivity.
Post-Add: Value that is added after the gain.
Soften: Makes the value "softer," but you also lose sound responsiveness.
widgets.default:
With these settings, you can adjust the level of the sound input.

In the background, the sound is analyzed using the RMS algorithm. You can use the parameters to determine how the value is used for the speed of the visuals and moving head movements.

Pre-Add: Value that is added before the gain.
Gain: The level is multiplied by this value. If the value is 0, there is no longer any sound reactivity.
Post-Add: Value that is added after the gain.
Soften: Makes the value "softer," but you also lose sound responsiveness.
